parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly. From dia and martureo; to attest or protest earnestly, or hortatively.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
